quickstart.rest

Class TeaResource

  • java.lang.Object
    • quickstart.rest.TeaResource

  • @Path(value="/v1/teastore")
public class TeaResource
extends java.lang.Object
    Root resource class hosted at the URI path "/v1/teastore"

    • Method Detail

      • getTeas

        @GET
@Path(value="teas")
@Produces(value="application/json")
public java.util.Map getTeas()
        getTeas

        Example request:
        GET /jersey2x/api/v1/teastore/teas HTTP/1.1
        Host: localhost:8090
        Content-Type: application/json

        Example response:
        HTTP/1.1 200 OK
        Content-Type: application/xml

        <?xml version="1.0" ?> <tea> <name>Default TeaName</name> <origin>Default Tea Origin</origin> <country>Default Tea Country</country> <year>0</year> </tea>

        Returns:
        Map - all the tea items in the tea database (in JSON format).
        On error returns HTTP Status Code 404.

      • createTea

        @POST
@Path(value="teas")
@Consumes(value="application/json")
@Produces(value="application/json")
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response createTea(Tea tea)
        createTea

        Parameters:
        Tea - object in JSON format
        Returns:
        Location header with the URL of the newly created resource + Body with newly created resource

        Example request:
        POST /jersey2x/api/v1/teastore/teas/ HTTP/1.1
        Content-type: application/json
        Host: localhost:8090

        {"name":"Maocha","origin":"Nannuo","country":"China","year":2008}

        Example response:
        HTTP/1.1 201 Created
        Location: http://localhost:8090/jersey2x/api/v1/teastore/teas/2
        Content-Type: application/json

        {"name":"Maocha","origin":"Nannuo","country":"China","year":2008}

      • getTea

        @GET
@Path(value="teas/{id}")
@Produces(value={"application/json","application/xml"})
public Tea getTea(@PathParam(value="id")
                           int id)
        getTea()

        Parameters:
        id - - tea item id
        Returns:
        Tea - a content negotiated version of a Tea item: XML (default) or JSON. On error returns HTTP Status Code 404.

        Example request:
        GET /jersey2x/api/v1/teastore/teas/1 HTTP/1.1 Host: localhost:8090

        Example response:
        HTTP/1.1 200 OK Content-Type: application/xml

        <?xml version="1.0" ?> <tea> <name>Default TeaName</name> <origin>Default Tea Origin</origin> <country>Default Tea Country</country> <year>0</year> </tea>

        To get back JSON, specify it in an Accept header:
        Example request:
        GET //jersey2x/api/v1/teastore/teas/1/ HTTP/1.1 Accept: application/json Host: localhost:8090

        Example response:
        HTTP/1.1 200 OK Content-Type: application/json { "name": "Default TeaName", "origin": "Default Tea Origin", "country": "Default Tea Country", "year": 0 }

      • getTeaJsonP

        @GET
@Path(value="teas/{id}/jsonp")
@JSONP(queryParam="callback")
@Produces(value="application/javascript")
public Tea getTeaJsonP(@QueryParam(value="callback")
                                      java.lang.String callback,
                                      @PathParam(value="id")
                                      int id)
        getTeaJsonP()

        Parameters:
        callback - - the JavaScript function callback that wraps the JSON object
        id - - tea item id
        Returns:
        Tea - a JSONP version of the Tea object, ie the JSON object wrapped in the function callback specified by the "callback" query string parameter On error returns HTTP Status Code 404.

        Example request:
        GET //jersey2x/api/v1/teastore/teas/1/jsonp?callback=foo HTTP/1.1 Host: localhost:8090

        Example response:
        HTTP/1.1 200 OK Content-Type: application/javascript

        foo({"name":"Default TeaName","origin":"Default Tea Origin","country":"Default Tea Country","year":0})

      • deleteTea

@Path(value="teas/{id}")
public void deleteTea(@PathParam(value="id")
                         int id)
        deleteTea()

        Parameters:
        id - - tea item id
